intro: Eulophidium analavelense, commonly known as the Madagascar velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
